intro: Tithymalus graminifolius, commonly known as the grass-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological importance, it is often found in conservation areas and botanical gardens.
